history.content:
If you're an EECS major, no. 

"Technical courses are defined as courses in engineering, computer science, data science, math, statistics, chemistry, the physical sciences or the biological sciences. (Please check the footnotes for your major program for a list of courses in these departments that are not considered technical.)

  • Any technical course that can be used to fulfill a requirement for your major must be taken for a letter grade. 
  • Each semester, you are required to take at least two technical courses that satisfy requirements for your major.
  • Your upper division technical GPA must be at least 2.0 in order to graduate."

This policy can be found online

I want to take EE120 P/NP before I have a total of 20 units of upper division technicals. I can do that, right?

My understand is that EE120 just wouldn't count towards my required 20 units, but someone told me otherwise. They said I have to have taken my 20 units before I can take any P/NP... 

If I take all the classes I plan to take I'll be well above the 20 unit minimum (actually next semester I'll already be over the 20 units) by the time I graduate.
history.subject: Taking upperdiv tech class P/NP
